headline: GameStop earnings, Consumer Confidence, home sales: What to Watch
summary: Market Domination Overtime hosts Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton break down what to watch on Tuesday, March 25. In the morning, Consumer Confidence data for March will be released. Economists expect a Consumer Confidence reading of 93.6, down from 98.3 in February. Monthly new home sales data for February will also be released in the morning; economists are anticipating an increase to 680,000 from the 657,000 seen in January. GameStop (GME), McCormick & Company (MKC), and Rumble (RUM) will all be reporting earnings on Tuesday. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here.

headline: How To Earn $500 A Month From McCormick Stock Ahead Of Q1 Earnings
summary: McCormick & Company, Incorporated (NYSE:MKC) will release its first-quarter financial results before the opening bell on Tuesday, March 25. Analysts expect the company to report quarterly earnings at 64 cents per share, up from 63 cents per share in the year-ago period. McCormick projects quarterly revenue of $1.61 billion, compared to $1.6 billion a year earlier, according to data from Benzinga Pro.
